description.narrative: The project ?Reconstructing our food systems? examines Finland as part of the global food system and evaluates the means and models by which Finnish actors jointly can promote a more sustainable just and inclusive food system. The project increases our und erstanding of our impact and identifies paths of change. The conclusions and proposals of the project will be communicated to the target groups selected by theme improving understanding of dependencies and shaped values to support a more just and sustainab le world.The project is coordinated with the national dialogue in Finland managed by the Ministry for Agriculture and Forestry both being part of the UN food system dialogue which will culminate to the Food Systems Summit (FSS) in 2021. It also produces ma terial for the 2021 Climate Conference (COP26) FFD brings together NGOs (members of the Fingo Food Security Group and WWF) commercial actors (e.g. S Group and Paulig) and others food system actors. The initiative assesses the pathways of change in the foo d system without prejudice and without swaying different perspectives. With the help of NGOs we consult our Southern partners. The project begins with a study of the baseline covering the themes included. The report will be supplemented by online surveys a nd panel discussions. The project builds on the key objectives of FSS: i) ensuring access to safe and nutritious food for all; 2) shifting to sustainable consumption patterns; 3) boosting nature-positive production at sufficient scale; 3) advancing equitab le livelihoods and value distribution and 5) building resilience to vulnerabilities shocks and stress. The project contributes to a more prosperous stable and more equal world as the goals of the Finnish Development Policy. The project is conducted transpa rently. Quality and consistency are ensured by a preparatory analysis and open hearings. Voice of women recognizing the role of developing countries and human rights are centric in the process.
